isis.stitle: 530 and DT-466/408 Diesel Engine Service (1994) - CONNECTING RODS, PISTONS, RINGS AND SLEEVES - PRIME THE LUBRICATING SYSTEM (PREFERRED METHOD)

svcproc.title: PRIME THE LUBRICATING SYSTEM (PREFERRED METHOD)
svcproc.para: When the engine has been reassemblied, it is recommended to lubricate the engine with oil before starting. This is done to prevent any damage to internal parts. The following procedure is the preferred method to use when priming the lubricating system.

step1.para: Pressure prime the lubrication system with oil, prior to starting as follows:

step2.para: Inject sufficient oil into the engine to fill the oil filters and charge the entire system.

warning.para: DO NOT rotate any diesel engine when priming with oil to prevent engine from accidentally starting.

step2.para: After priming, check the oil level before the engine is put back into service. Refer to chart for proper oil capacity.

note.para: Engines equipped with a by-pass filtering system require additional oil.

important.para: BE SURE THE ENGINE WAS WELL OILED DURING REASSEMBLY IN ORDER TO USE THIS PROCEDURE. IF THE ENGINE WAS NOT WELL OILED DO NOT USE THIS PROCEDURE, REFER TO "PRIME THE LUBRICATING SYSTEM (PREFERRED METHOD)" IN THIS SECTION FOR FURTHER INFORMATION.

step2.para: Use the following instructions prior to starting the engine. This is done to prevent any damage to internal parts.

step1.para: Spin but DO NOT start, the engine using the cranking motor until oil pressure is read on the oil pressure gauge.
When oil pressure is read, the engine may be started.
